DOC.brief_summary: Temporomandibular disorder ( TMD ) characterize pain tenderness muscle mastication and/or temporomandibular joint ( TMJ ) , limitation jaw open often accompany deviation mandibular path , click , pop grate TMJ sound . TMD often find association problem : depression , anxiety , sleep disturbance , gastrointestinal symptom , frequent infection , etc . This project propose holistically address patient symptom three different approach , Naturopathic Medicine ( NM ) , Traditional Chinese Medicine ( TCM ) , usual care KPNW . We conduct pilot test Phase II trial evaluate two alternative heal approach , TCM ( n=50 ) NM ( n=50 ) deliver TCM NM practitioner , effective usual TMD care ( n=50 ) provide dental clinician KPNW TMD Clinic . Subjects females 25-55 year age multiple health problem ( defined patient least 4 organ system-grouped diagnosis past year , include TMD ) . Subjects evaluate baseline , 6 12 month start treatment . The primary endpoint change baseline Axis II Pain Related Disability Psychological Status Scale . Clinical examination , saliva sample assess salivary cortisol level , response series questionnaires assess pain , chronic pain , psychosocial functioning , physical symptom use assess outcomes . We passively monitor health care utilization within KPNW use clinical , research , administrative database determine whether intervention impact overall health care utilization . If either alternative intervention show merit Phase III trial , goal design implement clinical trial evaluate health consequence cost alternative heal paradigm .
DOC.brief_title: Alternative Medicine Approaches Women With Temporomandibular Disorders
DOC.criteria: Patients least 4 organ systemgrouped diagnosis past year , include TMD
